Class Builder<T, T>

The Query Builder allows creating filtered and combined queries

Type parameters

  • T: Entity

  • T: Entity

  • Inherited from Condition.between

    • Defined in lib/query/Condition.ts:90

    Adds a between filter to the field. This is a shorthand for an less than and greater than filter.

    Parameters

    • field: string

      The field to filter

    • greaterValue: number | string | Date | Entity

      The field value must be greater than this value

    • lessValue: number | string | Date | Entity

      The field value must be less than this value

    Returns Filter<T>

    The resulting Query

Abstract eventStream

  • eventStream(options?: EventStreamOptions): Observable<RealtimeEvent<T>>
  • eventStream(options?: EventStreamOptions, onNext?: NextEventCallback<T>, onError?: FailCallback, onComplete?: CompleteCallback): Subscription
  • eventStream(onNext?: NextEventCallback<T>, onError?: FailCallback, onComplete?: CompleteCallback): Subscription
  • eventStream(options?: EventStreamOptions): Observable<RealtimeEvent<T>>
  • eventStream(options?: EventStreamOptions | NextEventCallback<T>, onNext?: NextEventCallback<T> | FailCallback, onError?: FailCallback | CompleteCallback, onComplete?: CompleteCallback): Subscription

  • Inherited from Query.eventStream

    Overrides Query.eventStream

    • Defined in lib/query/Query.ts:162

    Returns an observable that receives change events for a real-time query

    Multiple subscriptions can be created on top of this observable:

    
var query = DB.Todo.find();
var options = { ... };
var stream = query.eventStream(options);
var sub = stream.subscribe(onNext, onError, onComplete);
var otherSub = stream.subscribe(otherOnNext, otherOnError, otherOnComplete);

    Parameters

    • Optional options: EventStreamOptions

      to narrow down the events you will receive

    Returns Observable<RealtimeEvent<T>>

    an observable

  • Inherited from Query.eventStream

    Overrides Query.eventStream

    • Defined in lib/query/Query.ts:182

    Returns a subscription that handles change events for a real-time query.

    The underlying stream object is hidden. To create multiple subscriptions on the same stream, create the stream object first and then subscribe to the stream (see the other signature {@link #eventStream(options)}).

    Parameters

    • Optional options: EventStreamOptions

      to narrow down the events you will receive

    • Optional onNext: NextEventCallback<T>

      Called when an event is received

    • Optional onError: FailCallback

      Called when there is a server-side error

    • Optional onComplete: CompleteCallback

      Called when the network connection is closed (e.g. because of lost Wi-Fi connection)

    Returns Subscription

    a real-time query subscription

  • Inherited from Query.eventStream

    Overrides Query.eventStream

    • Defined in lib/query/Query.ts:197

    Returns a subscription that handles change events for a real-time query.

    The underlying stream object is hidden. To create multiple subscriptions on the same stream, create the stream object first and then subscribe to the stream (see the other signature {@link #eventStream(options)}).

    Parameters

    • Optional onNext: NextEventCallback<T>

      Called when an event is received

    • Optional onError: FailCallback

      Called when there is a server-side error

    • Optional onComplete: CompleteCallback

      Called when the network connection is closed (e.g. because of lost Wi-Fi connection)

    Returns Subscription

    a real-time query subscription

matches

  • matches(field: string, regExp: string | RegExp): Filter<T>

  • Inherited from Condition.matches

    • Defined in lib/query/Condition.ts:190

    Adds a regular expression filter to the field

    The field value must matches the regular expression.

    Note: Only anchored expressions (Expressions that starts with an ^) and the multiline flag are supported.

    see

    http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/reference/operator/query/regex/

    Parameters

    • field: string

      The field to filter

    • regExp: string | RegExp

      The regular expression of the filter

    Returns Filter<T>

    The resulting Query

near

  • near(field: string, geoPoint: GeoPoint, maxDistance: number): Filter<T>

  • Inherited from Condition.near

    • Defined in lib/query/Condition.ts:218

    Adds a geopoint based near filter to the GeoPoint field

    The GeoPoint must be within the maximum distance to the given GeoPoint. Returns from nearest to farthest.

    see

    http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/reference/operator/query/nearSphere/

    Parameters

    • field: string

      The field to filter

    • geoPoint: GeoPoint

      The GeoPoint to filter

    • maxDistance: number

      Tha maximum distance to filter in meters

    Returns Filter<T>

    The resulting Query

  • Inherited from Query.resultList

    Overrides Query.resultList

    • Defined in lib/query/Query.ts:100

    Execute the query and return the query results as a List

    Note: All local unsaved changes on matching objects, will be discarded.

    Parameters

    • Optional doneCallback: ResultListCallback<T>

      Called when the operation succeed.

    • Optional failCallback: FailCallback

      Called when the operation failed.

    Returns Promise<T[]>

    A promise that will be resolved with the query result as a list

Abstract resultStream

  • resultStream(options?: ResultStreamOptions): Observable<T[]>
  • resultStream(options?: ResultStreamOptions, onNext?: NextResultCallback<T>, onError?: FailCallback, onComplete?: CompleteCallback): Subscription
  • resultStream(onNext?: NextResultCallback<T>, onError?: FailCallback, onComplete?: CompleteCallback): Subscription
  • resultStream(options?: ResultStreamOptions): Observable<T[]>
  • resultStream(options?: ResultStreamOptions | NextResultCallback<T>, onNext?: NextResultCallback<T> | FailCallback, onError?: FailCallback | CompleteCallback, onComplete?: CompleteCallback): Subscription

  • Inherited from Query.resultStream

    Overrides Query.resultStream

    • Defined in lib/query/Query.ts:218

    Returns an observable that receives the complete real-time query result

    The full result is received initially (i.e. on subscription) and on every change.

    
var query = DB.Todo.find();
var stream = query.resultStream();
var sub = stream.subscribe(onNext, onError, onComplete);
var otherSub = stream.subscribe(otherOnNext, otherOnError, otherOnComplete);

    Parameters

    • Optional options: ResultStreamOptions

    Returns Observable<T[]>

    an observable on which multiple subscriptions can be created on

  • Inherited from Query.resultStream

    Overrides Query.resultStream

    • Defined in lib/query/Query.ts:239

    Returns a subscription that handles the complete real-time query result

    The full result is received initially (i.e. on subscription) and on every change.

    The underlying stream object is hidden. To create multiple subscriptions on the same stream, create the stream object first and then subscribe to the stream (see the other signature {@link #resultStream(options)}).

    Parameters

    • Optional options: ResultStreamOptions
    • Optional onNext: NextResultCallback<T>

      Called when the query result changes in any way

    • Optional onError: FailCallback

      Called when there is a server-side error

    • Optional onComplete: CompleteCallback

      Called when the network connection is closed (e.g. because of network timeout or lost Wi-Fi connection) and the specified number of reconnects have been exhausted; will never be called when infinite reconnects are configured (default)

    Returns Subscription

    a real-time query subscription handling complete query results.

  • Inherited from Query.resultStream

    Overrides Query.resultStream

    • Defined in lib/query/Query.ts:260

    Returns a subscription that handles the complete real-time query result

    The full result is received initially (i.e. on subscription) and on every change.

    The underlying stream object is hidden. To create multiple subscriptions on the same stream, create the stream object first and then subscribe to the stream (see the other signature {@link #resultStream(options)}).

    As the real-time query will reconnect infinitely often, there is no onComplete callback. (In other words, the observable will never complete.)

    Parameters

    • Optional onNext: NextResultCallback<T>

      Called when the query result changes in any way

    • Optional onError: FailCallback

      Called when there is a server-side error

    • Optional onComplete: CompleteCallback

      Called when the network connection is closed (e.g. because of network timeout or lost Wi-Fi connection) and the specified number of reconnects have been exhausted; will never be called when infinite reconnects are configured (default)

    Returns Subscription

    a real-time query subscription handling complete query results.

  • Inherited from Query.resultStream

    Overrides Query.resultStream

    • Defined in lib/query/Builder.ts:65
    inheritdoc

    Parameters

    • Optional options: ResultStreamOptions

    Returns Observable<T[]>

  • Inherited from Query.resultStream

    Overrides Query.resultStream

    • Defined in lib/query/Builder.ts:66

    Parameters

    • Optional options: ResultStreamOptions | NextResultCallback<T>
    • Optional onNext: NextResultCallback<T> | FailCallback
    • Optional onError: FailCallback | CompleteCallback
    • Optional onComplete: CompleteCallback

    Returns Subscription

  • singleResult(doneCallback?: SingleResultCallback<T>, failCallback?: FailCallback): Promise<T | null>

  • Inherited from Query.singleResult

    Overrides Query.singleResult

    • Defined in lib/query/Query.ts:126

    Execute the query that returns a single result

    Note: All local unsaved changes on the matched object, will be discarded.

    Parameters

    • Optional options: ResultOptions
    • Optional doneCallback: SingleResultCallback<T>

      Called when the operation succeed.

    • Optional failCallback: FailCallback

      Called when the operation failed.

    Returns Promise<T | null>

    A promise that will be resolved with the query result as a single result

  • Inherited from Condition.size

    • Defined in lib/query/Condition.ts:203

    Adds a size filter to the collection field

    The collection must have exactly size members.

    see

    http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/reference/operator/query/size/

    Parameters

    • field: string

      The field to filter

    • size: number

      The collections size to filter

sort

  • sort(sort: {}): Node<T>

  • Inherited from Query.sort

    Overrides Query.sort

    • Defined in lib/query/Query.ts:50

    Sets the sort of the query and discard all existing paramaters

    see

    http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/reference/method/cursor.sort/

    Parameters

    • sort: {}

      The new sort of the query which is an object whose keys are fields and the values are either +1 for ascending order or -1 for descending order

      • [field: string]: 1 | -1

    Returns Node<T>

    The resulting Query
